title: Celtics reportedly bring back Dalano Banton on 10-day contract
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Celtics signed Dalano Banton to a 10-day contract, bringing him back after his tenure with the Blazers in 2024.
Banton played two games for the Clippers this season and averaged 16.7 points in his last 30 games with Portland.
Boston converted rookie guard John Tonje from a two-way deal to a 10-day NBA contract, acquired last month from the Jazz.

title: Here’s why Ed Markey is boycotting the State of the Union — and what he and others are doing instead
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Sen. Ed Markey will boycott Trump's State of the Union, attending a 'People's State of the Union' rally instead.
The rally, organized by MoveOn and MeidasTouch, will feature people impacted by Trump policies and Democratic lawmakers.
Rep. Seth Moulton, challenging Markey in the Senate primary, will attend Trump's address, bringing detained immigrant Marcelo Gomes as his guest.

title: South Boston St. Patrick’s Parade to follow new route for 250th Evacuation Day
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: South Boston's St. Patrick's Day Parade will start at Andrew Square for its 250th Evacuation Day commemoration.
The parade will include a new route segment: from Thomas Park to G Street and East 6th Street, resuming on K Street.
Medal of Honor Park will serve as a family-friendly zone, aiming to manage larger crowds and honor historic routes.

title: New England has the best open-air and maritime museums in America, according to USA Today readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Plimoth Patuxet Museums in Plymouth was named the top open-air museum in the USA by USA Today readers.
Maine Maritime Museum in Bath received the top spot as the best maritime museum in the country.
Old Sturbridge Village ranked third in open-air museums, while Mystic Seaport Museum ranked third for maritime museums.

title: Second worker exposed to gas at Maine pulp mill dies
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Allen Hornberger, 26, died after nearly three weeks in critical condition due to toxic gas exposure at Baileyville mill.
The incident occurred on Jan. 27 during operations shutdown at Woodland Pulp Mill, leading to exposure.
Kasie Malcolm, a University of Maine student, also died after encountering the inhalation hazard at the same site.

title: Warriors’ Stephen Curry to miss Thursday’s game against the Celtics
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stephen Curry will miss the Warriors' game against the Celtics due to ongoing knee pain and swelling.
Curry has been sidelined since January 30 with a knee injury, leading to a 6-10 record for the Warriors without him.
Former Celtics players Krastaps Porzingis and Al Horford will play for Golden State against the Celtics on Thursday.

title: Local obituary: Bob Aliano, worked as a Roslindale barber for 67 years
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Bob Aliano, a longtime Roslindale barber, died on February 14, 2026; he worked at The Rialto Barber Shop since 1959.
Aliano was a resident of West Roxbury and former owner of The Rialto Barber Shop, survived by his children and siblings.
Visiting hours set for February 22 at P.E. Murray Funeral Home, with a funeral Mass at St. Theresa of Avila Church on February 23.

title: Red Sox infielder Caleb Durbin discussed how wrestling background helps with fielding
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Caleb Durbin, a newly acquired Red Sox infielder, has a wrestling background that aids his defensive skills on the field.
Flexibility in positions could see Durbin playing second base, though he mostly played third base with the Brewers last season.
Durbin's wrestling background contributes to his agility and positioning, traits praised by Red Sox manager Alex Cora and past coaches.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Feb. 19, 2026)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Boston Harbor Distillery will replace Trillium Brewing as the Greenway's beer garden, opening in Spring 2026.
Boston Provisions Market merges Wulf's Fish and Savenor’s Butchery, opening March 2, 2026, at 60 Harbor St., Seaport.
Lulu Green expands to a third location in Kendall Square, offering vegan dishes and cocktails, opening February 2026.

title: A Wendy’s near you may be closing soon
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Wendy's plans to close about 300 underperforming U.S. locations next year as part of profitability efforts.
Project Fresh will focus on closing stores and investing in growth potential with consultancy led by Greg Creed.
The closures represent about 5-6% of Wendy's U.S. restaurants; 98 locations are currently in Massachusetts.
